title: Modeling Acoustic Properties of Materials and Inquiry-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Physics and Mathematical Modeling, Proficiency in Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Learners utilize real-time data measurement and analysis tools via personal devices.

learning_goals: Three conceptual models explaining the acoustic transmission properties of materials can be mathematically expressed.
Sound intensity data can be measured using ICT tools (e.g., smartphone apps), converted into graphs, and interpreted.
Acoustic attenuation phenomena based on material properties can be modeled, and experimental results can be compared to analyze errors.

resources: Sound Measurement App or Equipment (Smartphone Microphone/External Microphone)
Samples of Materials with Various Acoustic Properties (e.g., Glass, Wood, Metal, Foam)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
